website_summaries.verdict: Good value for a printer that excels at color-photo printing as well as everyday printing, copying, and scanning needs.
pros: Printer is easy to use, as it includes a 5-inch touchscreen to operate the printer’s features while standing at the machine
Includes WiFi connectivity, which simplifies printing from mobile devices
Has a memory card slot, so you can print photos stored on the card directly
Can be operated in a quiet mode
cons: Uses a couple of extra ink cartridges, making the cost of consumables high

customer_reviews.title: $30 for a USB cable?  I don't think so!
customer_reviews.text: The title of this listing, with "set of ink tanks" listed separately, implies that a set of full-size ink tanks is included as a bonus in addition to the dinky "startup" tanks that come with most inkjet printers. That is NOT the case. My box contained only the startup ink, the 3-sheet paper sample, a cleaning cloth and a USB cable. So you're basically paying $30 for a USB cable (that you're not going to use because it's a wireless printer). Go find the separate listing for the TS9120 and buy it there.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Held

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and fantastic customer service from seller
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a printer that could meet all my needs. I thought this was the one except I didn’t realize that there isn’t a feeder to make multiple copies at once. This is something I definitely need. I proceeded to return the printer and Hot Electronics was fantastic during the whole return process. I received a full refund and I couldn’t be more impressed with the seller. Printer itself is very high tech and impressive. Super easy to sync with wifi and other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Liv

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality printer, and I love all the new technology. I can now print directly from my iPhone and iPad! Print quality is good and I highly recommend this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup wirelessly to my PC and smartphone! I had an issue with the black not printing and called Canon tech support and he solved it immediately. Print quality is great! Also, the printer arrived a day earlier than expected!!
customer_reviews.author: BrnEydSusan

customer_reviews.title: cannon ts 9120 wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: So far its doing a good job, was very easy to set up. Very good product. TKS J johnson
customer_reviews.author: James  L  Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good product marketing stinks
customer_reviews.text: Printer works fine but I opted to buy the printer with added package (an extra $30) thinking I was getting additional ink. You are actually paying $30 for about $5 worth of extras, a small cleaning cloth, an USB connection cord which if you are going wireless is not needed, and a few sheets of sample photo paper. They could at least have included the XL ink carts instead of standards for the extra money. DO NOT spend the extra $30 for the extra package, it's a rip off, just but the printer by itself. Appears to be a decent printer.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Download driver from web; set up wireless from printer itself
customer_reviews.text: Compact machine for small projects/home use. So far printing fine. Have not tried scanning yet. Instructions for wireless not entirely helpful. Had better luck connecting wireless via printer screen v. computer.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E. Yesis

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: The printer is smooth and easy. Great product for the cost and I've had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brent C. Travers

customer_reviews.title: Error during setup error code 5100
customer_reviews.text: This printer had great reviews, but I couldn't even get past setup due to an error code. On setup, the ink tray would not move to the center. I kept getting an error code. I checked online for troubleshooting for that specific error, but none of the recommendations fixed the error. Besides all that, the printer seemed flimsy and cheap, particularly the paper tray. I returned for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Armin ValipourKoleti

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Advertising.
customer_reviews.text: The printer itself is solid. Buy it by itself. This bundle makes it look like you get full ink tanks but it comes with the just the setup tanks that the printer comes with anyways. Yet they put it in the title like its an additional item and don't specify that it is the setup set. The printer was 30 dollars more here and all you get is a cable, the microfiber cloth, and the 3 photo papers. Not worth. Just buy them separate and save money. Even contacted their customer support and they just said yep that's the set you get.
customer_reviews.author: Clarckson

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a suitable produce for anyone that must scan or copy a doc with multiple pages. It is really just meant for photos.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Many Canon ink printers listed in Amazon have poor reviews. The TS9120 stood out from the crowd with a high rating. The printer has impressive new technology, easy connection to WiFi, extensive helpful software. It also prints well. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Kantor MD

customer_reviews.title: An excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This printer was very easy to set up, the instructions were clear, and it includes the USB cable. It has a small footprint which is great for my desk top. The print speed is fast for an inkjet printer, print quality is excellent. The alignment was easy to do, as was the download from the webpage of the driver. I did not need to use the supplied DVD. I like the corner plug in for power and USB, great for a desktop printer. The print quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Lou G.

customer_reviews.title: Seems good after a few days
customer_reviews.text: Using it with a Chromebook. Very little written instructions for Chrome, Canon passes you off to Google for run of the mill cloud registration then your left to manually configure the printer yourself for network comms. But there isn't any instructions on the printer for Chrome users...to Canon website you go or to online videos for setup. Canon's website info is still pandering to Windows/Apple crowd. The initial website referral for Chrome users sends you to a Japanese Canon site. just look to the top Right then choose United States. The picture should tell the obvious about Canon QC.. But Android and Iphone printing were flawless.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Keeps turning off, doesn't take standard ink cartridges, airdrop faulty
customer_reviews.text: This printer is frustrating to use. It turns off automatically after some random time, so if you go to print, you have to kjeep turning it on again. For some totally mysterious reason, when we use airdrop, it only accepts paper from the rear paper feed, not the standard tray. It also only accepts different cartridges that our other Canon printer, even though they look exactly the same, fit into the ink slots, but are electronically programmed to not work. Come on Canon, you can do a lot better than this! Thinking of getting another printer. It's pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful replacement for failed HP
customer_reviews.text: I love the relatively small size of this computer and the relative ease of programmed set up. Following the directions on the printer screen and on my computer had both my computer and my iPhone set up to use the printer wirelessly. I love it!! Printing was a bit slow but very very clear and silent. Shipment was quick and printer was carefully boxed to survive the experience. I am very pleased with the whole process!!
customer_reviews.author: Karin J.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay connected
customer_reviews.text: Awful. We are sending back. We were so excited for this but it is flimsy and literally will not stay connected to the WiFi. We also have to turn it on every time to get it to even re-connect to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh M

customer_reviews.title: Included ink cartridges are defective.
customer_reviews.text: I got this product today. I loaded in the first 4 ink cartridges without issue. When I tried to install the cyan cartridge most of the ink dumped into the cartridge tray in the half second before it clicked into place. Ink proceeded to drip out the bottom of the printer and ruin the desk the printer sits on. All printers are garbage. This one didn't print a single page before self destructing.
customer_reviews.author: Perpetual Notion

customer_reviews.title: All-in-one plus good photo printing
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We searched for an all-in-one rated well overall and with great photo printing capabilities and narrowed the list to this printer. Delivery was speedy, well packaged, and pretty easy to set up (though we did get some assistance from my engineer brother-in-law.) Once we had synced the wireless with one iphone, all of our other devices were able to find it and print easily. We printed several photos with very good quality (of course not excellent as one would expect from a photo-dedicated printer.) Great printer for a home office..... light years better than our old all-in-one!
customer_reviews.author: debra smith

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for a printer.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that out of the box the only thing that worked right was the power cabe.
customer_reviews.author: Joeseph Partsch

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year and I have struggled with this printer the entire time. It doesn't print - freezes up and you can't even stop the printing that is frozen. I realized now looking at my printer and the one that I ordered, that they sent me the wrong printer. completely different model and style. doesn't have the top feeder. Even when it does print, it wants you to add single papers to the back feeder tray that is intended for special paper. It won't take paper from the bottom tray where you load the majority of the paper. Total waste of space. I can't even print anything now. It eats up ink like crazy!!!!! Horrible!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K O'Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with 5G
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble with this printer. It worked for about 2 months and then stopped connecting with my 5G WiFi. I had to connect directly to my router with an ethernet cable which is inconvenient, but it worked. THEN, the printer just quit working all together and shows an error code of 6004 which is a feeder or jam issue. There was no jam or issue that happened the day before so I have no idea why this error code is there. Now I have NO printer and i am working from home. Needless to say, I am not happy with this product! FYI, the printer is less than a year old. grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Solid printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer!! Truly prints wireless and direct from I phone. The image quality is great, speed is average. The scanning is simple process. It was very easy to set the printer up. This included ink and a cable. Realized a cheaper version without the ink and cable. Not sure there was a benefit to buying this with added accessories.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for photos and home printing
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying this new printer. It is compact and has many features I like. The output tray automatically extends and recedes. I like the individual ink tanks so I only have to replace the one that was empty. My only negative was setting it up. Connecting it to my laptop went well but not so easy connecting to my smartphone. The directions may need to be updated. I look forward to using this printer for many years!
customer_reviews.author: NBCT

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: From setup to operation, it has been smooth and virtually effortless. As a retired network engineer and computer repair tech I've set up my fair share of printers. Most are a royal pain. This was easy (used Canon site download for drivers) and all operations run great. Price and value are unbeatable. I love the printers touch screen interface. It works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: flimsy piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: The back fell off while we were trying to load paper - the trays are less than easy to access. Would return it at once, but it's now been set up. Waste of money and effort. VERY disappointed. No wonder it is cheap....... For years, I had a Canon Pixma which was easy and pleasant to use; sadly it developed an error code that no one seemed able to fix. My mistake was ordering this cheap, flimsy printer. What a disappointment. UPDATE: bravo Amazon. I was able to return it. And ordered a better printer.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Buyer

customer_reviews.title: All this thing does is jam
customer_reviews.text: I realize printers are often practically disposable these days, but this is the worst one we've ever owned. It jams constantly, seemingly every 3rd time you try to print something. After only a few weeks we're considering sending it back and starting over, even after buying ink for it. The scanner works well and the print quality is good (when it works). Of course, it could be this particular one is defective rather than the entire model line, but either way I wish I bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: AMM

customer_reviews.title: Bricked after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: I use my printer almost everyday to print out only 3-5 pages per day. I've never used the scanner on it and I just turned the printer on to print and it's throwing a 5011 code. After some research it seems it's a scanner hardware defect that plagues this and similar Canon units, the defect renders the print totally dead and unusable. I also found out it's a VERY common issue, I would avoid this printer until they figure the issues out. It was a phenomenal printer for the 4 months it worked.
customer_reviews.author: I. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It’s worthless
customer_reviews.text: This printer doesn’t configure to anything. It’s useless. I payed a computer installer to to install the printer he couldn’t do it so now I’m out the money for the printer the the money for the installer. RIP OFF!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Black Hole for Ink - see the screenshot of consumption after I printed Startup Page
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to set up, lots of fiddly bits, but that's okay - I've set up and worked with dozens of printers over a 30 year period. It's annoying and awkward to insert the ink cartridges because the lid and scanner don't lift high enough. The start up page printed without any fuss, however trying to print printing has been a major pain. I still haven't been able to print anything. I like that there's a command screen. The printer itself is nice and light although I anticipate this being replaced quickly if it doesn't get squared away and work as intended.
customer_reviews.author: BestDayofMyLife

customer_reviews.title: Feels like you're in a time warp.
customer_reviews.text: Def recommend this printer if you want to feel like you're printing a book report on your grandma's printer in 1992. It's SO slow, something is always wrong with it (paper is in the wrong tray, even though it printed from that tray 30 seconds ago), BURNS through ink, and is not intuitive at all. I don't know what I was expecting for the price but it is almost laughably bad. Oh yeah, and it shakes and rattles while printing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have a Canon printer once again! We purchased a cheaper brand of printer when our previous Canon, after many years of good use, went out on us. Needless to say, the cheaper printer was a huge waste of money, as it presented constant problems. After 1 year of use, I am thrilled to get rid of it and get another Canon (which is printing great!)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Paper storage and paper output tray are very close together making it awkward to put new paper in, also is sensitive to error if not pushed in all the way. Color ink goes real fast when only using black and white color for printing. Otherwise a very nice printer for a very reasonable price. I do love the compact and lighter size.
customer_reviews.author: Tigers Fan

customer_reviews.title: Can't stay connected to wifi
customer_reviews.text: It prints reasonably well. It is the only device in my home that cannot stay connected to my network. Every time I print, my computer can't connect to the printer. I have to go turn off the printer, turn it back on, and then it will print. Every single time. Unless it's a large job, in which case it might lose connection halfway through. Poking around the internet, it seems this is kinda how Canons (fail to) work.
customer_reviews.author: Blatay

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This printer is no longer working properly after only 8 months. And I have had periodic problems the entire time. It has now stopped printing entirely, even though I put in brand new ink cartridges. For the last month before it stopped printing, it stopped printing bar codes for some reason, unless I took a screen shot and printed as a photo. And it periodically for no reason switches the print tray from cassette to rear printing without my touching the settings. Am very disappointed and frustrated to the point where I want to throw it out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Raina

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRINTER I EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: I have had the printer a few months and all of a sudden it wont copy correctly, always cutting of 1/2 - 3/4 of page, always getting paper jams doesn't turn on when I send something to be printed as it did for ONE month. I am getting another printer from STAPLES where I can CALL IN OR WALK IN with tech issues. My last 2 printers were HP's were perfect and lasted 10+ years each w NO issues!! Until they wore themselves out...
customer_reviews.author: carol peek

customer_reviews.title: It comes with built in software
customer_reviews.text: It has many features and makes great copies. I bought this one sine it came with the UBS cable to hardwire it to my computer. I don't have wifi where I currently live so some things are not available for me to use. Like printing from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: ztruMarmee

customer_reviews.title: easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far. Ink is a little expensive, but delivers good color. Goood seller, on time.
customer_reviews.author: ralph a delrosso

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for my personal use. What I most liked about this product is the simplicity to set it up to my laptop and also to my smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing photo quality
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use app that lets you print pictures. No need to go to target or Walmart to print pics - simply do it from your home. Only downside is no USB port to connect for easy printing. It has to be sent via the app.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Problems printing
customer_reviews.text: The set up of this printer was easy. However each time I print, I get the warning that the tray is out of paper. It isn't. So I press OK, and repeat about 5 times before it actually prints. I could not find a help other than "put paper in the tray".
customer_reviews.author: Elisa B. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: go with another printer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using or trying to use for six months and it is a pain. Basically very slow to print and always having to be re-booted plus eats ink worse than my old HP printer. I ordered based upon reviews, well they must have been paid for as this printer is a piece of crap. Spend more money and get anything else. Oh by the way it never worked on Wifi and is super slow. Stay away form this one.
customer_reviews.author: Reason 1248

customer_reviews.title: thought it was great until...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this printer was great, until I had a big print job where I was printing a bunch of labels for items to ship. Then I found that things kept getting stuck, or jammed. It was one problem after another. It only worked wirelessly for about a week. Then it had to be connected via usb. I had a lot of hopes for this printer in the beginning, and they just did not pan out.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay d'Aversa

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 4 hours to set this printer up. The user manual and Canon support materials were mostly useless. It prints OK. The best thing I can say about the printer is that it's small, which is just one of the things I need from it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I am so frustrated! I want to return this piece of crap. I've barely used it and I only buy legit ink for it (cost an arm and a leg for ) and now it keeps growing out that it's false ink ad even though I only print in black as white all the ink cartridges are saying they are empty. I cat even return it at this point an the rech support never goes through. Sighhhhh biggest purchase mistake this year.
customer_reviews.author: jomo

customer_reviews.title: It's a good printer
customer_reviews.text: I hate printers because the ink is almost as expensive as the printer. But so far this printer has been worth it. It was easy to setup. It has feature s that a person at home uses the most. And the ink is at least reasonably priced. To date we have printed plenty of pictures and letters. Copied multiple documents, and printed straight from the phones. We have been surprised at the quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: J N Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Once the ink cartridges were done, this machine started acting up. Sensors were not talking to each other, or some such thing. Messages had to do with the purple ink cartridge not being recognized. What a pain. Save yourself the trouble. These made in China machines are designed to be temporary so that you can keep on buying more and more of them.
customer_reviews.author: stratasphere

customer_reviews.title: Quality photo image reproduction
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about this printer. Photos are beautiful, printed documents are clear, scanner is very good, touch screen is nice and wireless printing from any device is such a convenience. Set-up was easy and integration with all devices was seamless. Can’t beat this printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Not pleased
customer_reviews.text: The printing speed is slow and if the printer is turned off ( it times out and turns itself off) you can’t print from it. After using this for nine months it kept giving me an error message and quit working. It’s now sitting in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Candy M

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer due to our old printer not being compatible with Windows 10. It was easy to set up and appears thus far to be completely compatible with Windows 10. Also, it is much quieter than our old printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarg

customer_reviews.title: very good prints.
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great, but for me, it took a little getting used to. Like the last Pixma printer I bought, it repeatedly asked about the paper, and changed from using paper loaded in the bottom to insisting it be loaded in the tray at the back of the printer. It appears to have a mind of it's own.
customer_reviews.author: TrishD.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated with all the glitches. Takes tons of time to figure out. Support is poor
customer_reviews.text: The printer has good quality when it works. It is a total pain and nightmare on how it prints and where it prints from. I have gone through settings and gone to Canon Website to find answers. It's always a basic step by step that leads no where. The documents print smaller than an 8.5 x 11... I go and fix settings and there are different options that meet this spec. Totally confusing and frustrating. Ready to throw it out the window. I loved my previous model, never had issues like this. Literally has made me rethink ever purchasing anything Canon again. P.S. I do tech like stuff all the time. What a disappointment and waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: prompt delivery, with no damage
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my previous Canon printer as it quit working. The delivery was prompt and well packed. No negative issues. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Doug Paul

customer_reviews.title: F/u review after my "Piece of Crap" review yesterday
customer_reviews.text: Went to Staples last night and bought an HP 6978 for $10 cheaper. MUCH better. Scanning with that Canon was a tedious nightmare - one document at a time. The HP auto feeds. Easier to connect and use almost immediately and don't have that irritating Canon window all the time in the corner of my screen. PLEASE don't buy this Canon piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great Network Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: We had replaced a printer and had limited space. This is such an improvement for us. Easy to use. Easy to set up. We use it as a network for our home and it handles multiple devices and gives us no trouble. It was a great buy for us
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Donohoe

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, space saver
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement printer because the document feeder in the HP printer stopped working a few months after I got it. It was easy to set up and works just great.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Van Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: This printer sucks!
customer_reviews.text: After a short period of time, this printer failed to function. Attempting to contact Canon was extremely difficult and was not helpful. I am fairly proficient with electronics and peripherals, and the design of this unit, especially with respect accessibility, is very poor. Advise researching and purchasing another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Error code after error code, dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Did not even last a year. For the price it should have lasted at least a decade. Can reset, gets clogged, when trying to clean peices easily break... just not worth the price tag, no wonder they dont put a decent warranty on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: poor product
customer_reviews.text: dislike 1) worst printer I've ever purchased. unable to even copy a pix without A)wanting paper in rear slot. B) use an i phone ( don't have one) C)Insists I connect to wireless, Unable to connect directly, D) Called the help line and got someone from India w ho wanted to charge me $99,00 to assist me. I purchased the printer for the "ease of installation". I would like to return it, but I think it is too late. I tried to give it away but nobody wanted it . Bad product.
customer_reviews.author: eddy current

customer_reviews.title: Buy something different.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work constantly. Won't feed paper. Doesn't hold much paper. Paper tray is a pain to load. I've only had it 6 months. But it's getting replaced. I'm kirsty trying to use it once a week to print something. Can't make that happen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Cannon Printer
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a great printer; not easily installed but what is really? I would recommend this printer for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is really a great printer
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this printer. It is easy to use and the print quality is excellent. I had a HP and this beats the HP hands down!
customer_reviews.author: Janet C.

customer_reviews.title: Died on day two.
customer_reviews.text: Worked one day. Quick setup. Great print. Fast and quiet. For one day. Then, knocks every other device off wifi. No one can communicate when the printer is 'online'. Go to Best Buy where you can speak to a person. Day three: User error. My bad. Reread all instructions and solved to mystery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of reviews before buying this printer and the internet let me down. I'm less than impressed with this printer. Print quality is good and set up was easy but the overall operation is complicated and buggy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Peters

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to get to work
customer_reviews.text: Ive had it a few weeks and still haven't gotten it to print. I follow the on-screen directions. It says to put in a writeable disk. I did so. Then I tried to print and it whirred a bit and spit the disk out. I still haven't called tech support. I'm just to annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela D. Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a month
customer_reviews.text: This printer sounded like it had a problem from the start and then 3 weeks after I started using it, the paper jammed, an error message came on and that was it. Tech support was very nice but didn't have any strategies to correct the error. Canon is replacing it (saying it was still under warranty) with a different model. The new model is listed at $30 cheaper than what I paid for this one. Not sure of the difference in models or why the difference in price. Feeling like I should have stuck with HP.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Berke

customer_reviews.title: Difficult setup
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Replacing Epson that did not last. Setup is not straight forward. I set mine up for wireless printing from my IPad. Do not like the print app that came with printer. Could be better and setup instructions could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R. Tatum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal
customer_reviews.text: Amazing printer. It prints so quickly and clearly. My only issue is how expensive the ink is but it's more than worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Lasseter

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and price!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great. I was able to set it up in about an hour to our two computers. Prints great too. I liked the ease of set up and price. Delivery was on time and packed well.
customer_reviews.author: Radjahmoon

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive everything pictured here, only the printer and power cord. Despite hooking everything up to my LAN, nothing can find the printer the first time. I have to get up, turn it on, wait a bit, and then it MAY work.
customer_reviews.author: Whatanutt

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: We needed a second printer, for color jobs, and this seemed to fit the bill. Replacing a 10-year-old Canon. Easy to set up, on the network. Nothing to complain about so far. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff Lover

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer less than a year and the touch screen completely stopped working. So you can’t to anything with it. now it’s a paperweight and I need to get it replaced!
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: good product.
customer_reviews.text: very nice color print, on paper and cd. like all printers, original replacement ink is premium priced. liked the remote turn on capability, but this option must be turned on.
customer_reviews.author: osmond

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer don’t waste money
customer_reviews.text: There is no USB Or SD plug to print file. The only way you can print is over WiFi (if it connect) or cable connected to PC. I am done with Canon. Why will you put USB slot but not allow to print from it? Getting Brother again
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: No disappointments here, a great printer.
customer_reviews.text: My previous 9120 lasted only 14 months, kept giving a "paper jam" message on the screen. I liked it so much though, decided to keep with the same model. It's just a good printer!
customer_reviews.author: B. Willett

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, scanner glass has dust inside
customer_reviews.text: It's a little bit laggy in printing double-sided, but that's not too big of a deal. The annoying part is the little particles of dust trapped on the underside of the scanner glass. I cleaned it off as well as I could on top and the little specs show up in my scans which is super annoying ... at least I have photoshop >.<
customer_reviews.author: littleben

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great, no issues. Assembly part of it is very easy to identify parts and install it as the menu guide walks you through step by step from start to finish. The coloring of the ink cartridges is consuming, not even 6 months that I bought this printer is running out a lot on the ink. And we didn’t print a lot of pictures, just quite a few ones and the toner is low on ink, that is the only reason why I rate it a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad printer.  Constantly malfunctioning.
customer_reviews.text: It’s been non functional more than functional. The ink doesn’t last long (despite low usage and using Canon ink). I wish I could return it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. A breeze to set up and prints effortlessly from iPhone and WI-FI. I’ll not buy another HP.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Welch

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma TS9120 is a fantastic value!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I got this Canon Pixma TS9120 printer. The footprint is smaller than the printer I had before. I love that it prints the last page of a series first so that your first requested page shows up on top! No more shuffling papers to get them in the right order. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Suddreth

customer_reviews.title: Liked it I guess
customer_reviews.text: Did set up easier than any before actually. Prints faster than the other Canon I owned Don;t know about tech support, never used.
customer_reviews.author: York H. Sinkler

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away from the Canon TS9120
customer_reviews.text: The Canon TS9120 is not a reliable printer. It constantly jams so much that I’m surprised when it actually prints a document. There are times I must reboot the printer to have it print. Many times I receive an error message that printer is out of paper even with a full tray. If you are looking to be frustrated every time you want to print something then this is the printer for you. My advice is to “stay away” from the Cannon TS9120.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Richards

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: You will need to manually turn it on before using this. That’s a pain for remote printing. Otherwise it was easy to install, works well and the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mclaren

customer_reviews.title: Good print qwalitt this far
customer_reviews.text: It works well print qwalitt is great not sure how I feel about the design of the printer. Haven't gotten a chance to play with it much.
customer_reviews.author: Ciy

customer_reviews.title: It is a printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer works. Only downside is it has to be turned on every time. The old printer would wake up from sleep mode if you sent something to print from your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This printer was easy to set up and worked on the first try. The print quality is excellent and paper loading and feed works very well. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: macsog60

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Printer is soooooo slowwwww....i set it to print something and go make a coffee, come back and maybes its starting to print. Scan is slow, but the scan to cloud feature is nice. overall, meh
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Price is reasonable
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old mx850 printer, which was a gem. I hope this one last and works as great as the last one I had.
customer_reviews.author: gloria manning

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma TS9120 Wireless multi-purpose Printer
customer_reviews.text: The multi-purpose, wireless printer was packed and insulated well. And the price was very good. The set-up was very easy . I didn't have any issues with the print quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Kidani

customer_reviews.title: Printer error problem rampant, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I’m on my hire one in less than 3 months, technical errors on each one. Do not buy. I will ask for my third replacement today, maybe I will get lucky.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Washington

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and connect to my Mac. Great Product!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric S Massey

customer_reviews.title: The print quality is great!
customer_reviews.text: I am not in favor of the flimsy feed trays, but they appear to be functional I’ll have to be careful not to damage them! They could have been a bit sturdier!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Siler

customer_reviews.title: Basic Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good basic printer but does not have a lot of the functionality as the other multi-functional printers.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Will not even power-up anymore and burns ink quickly. Of course all “return windows” have closed. Big waste of $ for both the actual printer and due to its ink use. Keep looking you can find this quality for $40 elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Regret purchase
customer_reviews.text: Day 3 of trying to get it set up .. nothing but error codes..I can't actually tell you about any of the functions or how it printer how it works because I can't get it set up.. I've never had a printer this hard in this complicated to set up with so many problems everyone I've ever owned was really simple..I'm definitely hating making this purchase and the inconvenience is caused me... I wish I had bought an HP...
customer_reviews.author: brenda Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: The Best printer I ever had!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly!!! Once you go over the instruction booklet evrything came tother and it's the best printer I have EVER had!
customer_reviews.author: David Van Sise Sr.

customer_reviews.title: So quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my former HP printer this is so quiet it also has a smaller footprint and my computer isn't assaulted several times daily with useless and intruding updates.
customer_reviews.author: Kiefrelief

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with printer.
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky in the WiFi set-up, but otherwise satisfied with the printer; photo reproduction. WiFi set-up took 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: PLH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer I just wish it came with a instruction manual BOOK not a CD. I have a Mac and can't put a CD in to read instructions so I had to figure things out on my own. It wasn't too hard just didn't realize there was more then one place to add paper.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: wretched
customer_reviews.text: yet another copier which gives a false paper jam signal and then nothing works to get it right. returned it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C. Miller

product_meta.title: Canon Pixma MX532 Wireless Office/Home Inkjet All-in one Printer, Copier, Scanner, Fax, Google Cloud Print & AirPrint + Set of Ink Tanks + USB Printer Cable + HeroFiber Cloth
feature_bullets: This kit includes: Canon MX532 Wireless Office/Home Inkjet All-in one Printer, Set of Ink Tanks; includes: PG-240 Black Ink Cartridge, CL-241 Color Ink Cartridge, Telephone Line Cable (for Fax), Power Cord, USB Printer Cable for PC Connection, HeroFiber Ultra Gentle Cleaning Cloths Getting Started Guide & Setup CD-ROM

BUILT-IN WIRELESS: Print and scan wirelessly from any Wi-Fi enabled computer around the house. HIGH RESOLUTION: 4800 x 1200 maximum color dpi produces incredible quality and detail in both your business documents and photos

BUILT-IN AUTO DUPLEX PRINTING: Automatically print on both sides of the page without the hassle of turning it over manually. This can reduce your paper consumption and cost by up to 50%. 30-SHEET DUPLEX AUTO DOCUMENT FEEDER: Easily copy, scan and fax multiple documents without having to load them one page at a time

MY IMAGE GARDEN: My Image Garden software makes organizing and printing your photos fun and easy with great facial recognition, Special Filters, Calendar Organization, Automatic Layout Suggestions and so much more!
CREATIVE PARK PREMIUM: An exclusive service for users of genuine Canon inks, offering access to photos, templates and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars349 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
